p: Over the next year, six further human cases of monkeypox infection were reported in Liberia, Sierra Leone and Nigeria (Foster et al. 1972). From 1970 to 1979, 47 human cases of monkeypox were identified, 38 of which were from Zaire, and the majority were in close proximity to the tropical rainforest (Nalca et al. 2005). A total of 79 cases were subsequently reported over the next 12 years. In 1996–1997 a major outbreak involving 88 cases occurred; between 2001 and 2002 51 human cases were reported in the Democratic Republic of Congo (Hutin et al. 2001; Heymann et al. 2008).
